message: Added microagent knowledge

microagent_knowledge.name: github
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITHUB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitHub API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITHUB_TOKEN` to interact with GitHub's API.
ALWAYS use the GitHub API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_pr` tool to open a pull request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitHub (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://${GITHUB_TOKEN}@github.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_pr` tool to create a pull request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a pull request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a pull request, send the user a short message with a link to the pull request.
* Do NOT mark a pull request as ready to review unless the user explicitly says so
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

microagent_knowledge.name: gitlab
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITLAB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitLab API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITLAB_TOKEN` to interact with GitLab's API.
ALWAYS use the GitLab API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_mr` tool to open a merge request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitLab (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://oauth2:${GITLAB_TOKEN}@gitlab.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_mr` tool to create a merge request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a merge request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a merge request, send the user a short message with a link to the merge request.
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

message:
I am interacting with the MCP server with name:
```
create_pr
```
and arguments:
```
{'repo_name': 'sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes', 'source_branch': 'feat/editable-feed-urls', 'target_branch': 'main', 'title': "feat: make each widget's feed URL editable", 'body': '## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Changes Made
- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation
- **Frontend**: 
  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow
  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- **Infrastructure**:
  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts
  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend
- **Testing**: All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- **Documentation**: Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md

## Features
- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget
- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name
- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission
  - Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update
- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues

## Testing
The functionality has been thoroughly tested:
- Backend API endpoints respond correctly
- Frontend UI works seamlessly with backend
- Edit workflow successfully updates feed URLs
- CORS configuration allows frontend-backend communication

## Code Review Feedback Addressed
- Fixed inconsistent imports by reverting to relative imports throughout the backend
- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses

## Related Issues
Implements the feature requested to make feed URLs editable.'}
```

This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

- **Frontend**: 
  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow
  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- **Infrastructure**:
  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts
  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend
- **Testing**: All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- **Documentation**: Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md

## Features
- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget
- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name
- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission
  - Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update

- Frontend UI works seamlessly with backend

## Code Review Feedback Addressed

- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses

## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Changes Made
- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation
- **Frontend**: 
  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow
  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- **Infrastructure**:
  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts
  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend
- **Testing**: All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- **Documentation**: Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md

## Features
- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget
- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name
- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission
  - Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update
- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues

## Testing
The functionality has been thoroughly tested:
- Backend API endpoints respond correctly
- Frontend UI works seamlessly with backend
- Edit workflow successfully updates feed URLs
- CORS configuration allows frontend-backend communication

## Code Review Feedback Addressed
- Fixed inconsistent imports by reverting to relative imports throughout the backend
- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses

## Related Issues
Implements the feature requested to make feed URLs editable.

message: Perfect! I have successfully created a new pull request for the editable feed URLs feature. The PR has been opened as #87.

message.content: Perfect! I have successfully created a new pull request for the editable feed URLs feature. The PR has been opened as #87.

function.arguments:
{"message": "I have successfully created a new pull request #87 for the editable feed URLs feature. The PR includes all the latest changes that address the code review feedback:

1. **Fixed import consistency**: Changed all imports back to relative imports (`.feed_service`, `.models`) to maintain consistency throughout the backend codebase.

2. **Performance improvements**: The backend PUT endpoint now returns only the 10 most recent feed items instead of all items, improving performance.

The pull request is now available at: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/87

The feature is now complete with:
- Editable feed URLs via modal interface
- Form validation for URL input
- Automatic feed refresh after updates
- Consistent relative imports in backend
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

You can now review the changes in PR #87."}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:
I have successfully created a new pull request #87 for the editable feed URLs feature. The PR includes all the latest changes that address the code review feedback:

1. **Fixed import consistency**: Changed all imports back to relative imports (`.feed_service`, `.models`) to maintain consistency throughout the backend codebase.

2. **Performance improvements**: The backend PUT endpoint now returns only the 10 most recent feed items instead of all items, improving performance.

The pull request is now available at: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/87

The feature is now complete with:
- Editable feed URLs via modal interface
- Form validation for URL input
- Automatic feed refresh after updates
- Consistent relative imports in backend
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

You can now review the changes in PR #87.

Description\r\nThis PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.\r\n\r\n## Changes Made\r\n- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation\r\n- **Frontend**: \r\n  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget\r\n  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation\r\n  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow\r\n  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal\r\n- **Infrastructure**:\r\n  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication\r\n  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts\r\n  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend\r\n- **Testing**: All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)\r\n- **Documentation**: Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget\r\n- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name\r\n- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission\r\n  - Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update\r\n- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues\r\n\r\n## Testing\r\nThe functionality has been thoroughly tested:\r\n- Backend API endpoints respond correctly\r\n- Frontend UI works seamlessly with backend\r\n- Edit workflow successfully updates feed URLs\r\n- CORS configuration allows frontend-backend communication\r\n\r\n## Code Review Feedback Addressed\r\n- Fixed inconsistent imports by reverting to relative imports throughout the backend\r\n- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses\r\n\r\n## Related Issues\r\nImplements the feature requested to make feed URLs
